sense.name: a set of connected railroad cars
sense.examples: We had to wait for a slow freight train at the crossing. Mary took the train to New York. The trains are on strike today in Italy.

sense.name: a sequence of events
sense.examples: They had a train of disasters at the factory last month. His train of thought led him to the conclusion that black holes have entropy. I lost my train of thought when the phone rang. You may be setting in motion a train of events that will cause harm to the negotiations.

sense.name: a moving line of transport animals, a caravan
sense.examples: They shipped the borax out of the desert by mule train. Trains of camels and horses carried products of trade all along the ancient Silk Road. The wagon train formed a circle at night, for protection. (animals pulling wagons)

sense.name: a long trailing piece of fabric attached to a gown
sense.examples: The bride's gown had a 20-foot train of pure silk. The princess picked up the train of her gown in one hand and rushed down the stairs.

sense.name: set of rotating gears that transmit force
sense.examples: The mechanic examined the machine's train of gears for damage. The assistant caught his long hair in the gear train.

sense.name: a retinue of attendants to an important person
sense.examples: The queen was followed by a train of ladies in waiting. A train of lackeys rushed about, readying the room for the emperor's appearance.
